question: A 55-year-old male presented to the clinic with the complaint of fever, weight loss, and back pain. On physical examination, extreme tenderness was noticed at the lumbar vertebrae. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the lumbar spine showed evidence of Pott’s disease. Which of the following organisms is most commonly involved in this disease process?

A 58-year-old woman discussed osteoporosis with her physician. She was worried that for a couple of years, after menopause, she was at an increased risk for osteoporosis. Which of the following is prescribed initially to prevent the risk of future problems?

answers.option: Infusion of potent bisphosphonates at large intervals
Maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D through diet modification and/or supplementation

question: Which of the following can be caused by inhalation of coal dust?
What will be the primary cause of death from massive acetaminophen overdose?
Which of the following is a common early complication of a supracondylar fracture of the humerus?
Which of the following autoimmune diseases is associated with the highest rate of malignancy?
Which of the following is the best first step of management for osteoarthritis?
What are the effects of radiation in the eye?
Which of the following drugs is effective in managing acute gouty arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and also accelerates closure of patent ductus arteriosus in premature infants?

A 28-year-old male presents to the clinic because of swollen, painful small joints in his right hand. On examination, there is a scaly rash on the extensor surfaces of the skin and scalp. Which of the following diagnosis is most consistent with this case?
Osteomyelitis is most commonly a bacterial infection that arises via hematogenous spread. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of this disease?
Which of the following is the most common complication of talus neck fracture?

A patient with a history of chronic hypertension develops an acute gout attack. He is currently on a four-drug regimen, consisting of hydrochlorothiazide, valsartan, amlodipine, and atenolol. What is the most likely reason for the precipitation of his gout attack?

A 40-year-old female patient presents with back pain and extreme weight loss. She was diagnosed with breast cancer 5 years ago but she denied chemotherapy or any other form of treatment. What will be the next best investigation?
An 8-year-old male child presents with unilateral thigh swelling and a restricted range of motion. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following drugs is not contraindicated in a patient with hemophilia?

A 16-year-old child comes with his parents to the outpatient department. The parents complain to the doctor that their child has a short stature and has not developed puberty yet. The doctor examines the child and concludes that the bone age is less than the chronological age and diagnoses the child with constitutional growth delay. The parents are worried about the final height of the child. What would be the best treatment for this child?

answers.option: Surgery to increase the height of femur
No treatment and the final height is decreased.

question: A young gymnast comes to the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of lower back pain. The clinician after taking radiographs concluded that there is a defect in the pars interarticularis. What is this condition called?

A man with a history of a fall presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of pain in the lower back. On examination, the power in the lower limbs is 2/5 and the perianal sensation is intact. There is no urinary retention. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A young male with a history of heavy weight lifting presents to the emergency with the complaint of severe radiating pain in both limbs and perineal numbness. On examination, there is motor weakness in both lower limbs. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 30-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of acute onset shoulder pain. On examination, the external rotation is possible and there is a sub-acromial calcification seen on a plain radiograph. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A patient presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of bone pain and deafness for the past few days. He also complains about increasing hat size. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following effects of morphine is the most resistant to development of tolerance?
Which of the following cases produces "light bulb" sign on X-ray anteroposterior view?
What is the most common management of clavicular fractures?
Which of the following is the most appropriate sequence of events involved in the healing of fractures?
What is the mechanism by which ethanol increases acetaminophen toxicity?

answers.option: Activates P450 to convert acetaminophen to toxic metabolites
Reduces renal clearance of acetaminophen and its metabolites
Competitively inhibits the enzymes responsible for acetaminophen metabolism
Inactivates P450 to inhibit acetaminophen metabolism
Non-competitively inhibits the enzymes responsible for acetaminophen metabolism

question: During which weeks of gestation is a fetus most prone to developing teratogenic limb defects?
What is the most accurate definition of spondylolisthesis?

answers.option: Degeneration of a vertebral body and the disc under it
Slipping of a vertebra over the one below it
Fracture through the pars interarticularis of a vertebra
Inflammation of the joints between the vertebrae

question: According to the Salter-Harris classification, which fracture type looks normal on an X-ray?
What is the mode of spread of snake venom within the human body?
A worker in a marble-cutting and sand-blasting industry may have which of the following occupational diseases?
Which of the following is absorbed by the ozone at the stratosphere?
According to the Cierny-Mader classification, which of the following statements is not true?

answers.option: Stage 2 is localized osteomyelitis with portion of medullary involvement and dead cortical bone
Host factor A denotes no co-morbidities, B denotes immunocompromised host and C denotes severe disease
Stage 2 is superficial osteomyelitis which is localized to the bone surface

question: A patient presents with a 12 cm laceration on the right shin with the protrusion of his fractured tibia through the laceration. According to the Gustilo-Anderson classification, what is the type of this fracture?

A middle-aged woman presents to the clinic with a complaint of swelling on the left side of the neck. Investigation reveals an increase in serum calcium levels. What is the most common cause of primary hyperparathyroidism?

An elderly man presents to the clinic with a large painful mass in his shoulder. Biopsy shows anaplastic chondrocytes and hyaline cartilage matrix. Which of the following statements is true regarding this lesion?

answers.option: High grade lesions favor lymphatic spread
Some of its variants are clear cell and mesenchymal
Most low grade lesions show anaplasia and abnormal mitoses

question: Which of the following structures is the base of the odontoid process?
What is the antidote used in the case of acetaminophen poisoning?
What is the main advantage of the slow sand filter (SSF) over the rapid sand filter (RSF)?

answers.option: SSF has a greater filtration rate than RSF
SSF has the same depth as RSF
SSF provides better purification of water than RSF
SSF requires less area than RSF
SSF is cheaper to set up than RSF

question: A patient presents with a complaint of knee pain. Investigation results revealed a serum uric acid of 17 mg/dl and urinary uric acid levels of 800 mg/24 hours. After the use of some prescribed first-line medication, the serum uric acid levels were 3.5 mg/dl and urinary uric acid levels were 500 mg/24 hours. Which of the following medications was most likely prescribed to the patient?
What is the mechanism of calcium regulation exerted by parathyroid hormone?

answers.option: Increasing osteoclast activity and bone resorption
Inhibiting synthesis of calcitriol by the renal tubules

question: What is the purpose of an MRI in a patient with Ewing's sarcoma?

answers.option: To assess the zone of transition
To guide a biopsy of the lesion

question: What is the normal shape of the cervical spine?
A young male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of pain in the knee and ankle joints, redness of the eyes, and pain on micturition. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following vertebrae is involved in Jefferson's fracture?

A 7-year-old boy was prescribed an anti-pyretic for influenza. After 4 days of treatment, he died on the 5th day. An autopsy revealed microvesicular fatty infiltration in the liver, heart, and kidneys, and cerebral edema was also present. Which anti-pyretic was the boy using?
Which of these is a side effect of meperidine only at high or repeated doses?

A newborn is brought dead to the outpatient department. He presents with a foot deformity where inward deformity of the heel, varus deformity of the forefoot, and plantar flexion are noted. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

answers.option: Talipes equinovalgus with neural tube defects
Talipes equinovarus with neural tube defects
Talipes equinovarus with developmental dysplasia of the hip
Developmental dysplasia of the hip with polydactyly

question: A patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of difficulty in swallowing, red eyes, and parotid gland swelling. Anti-ro antibodies and anti-la antibodies are positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presents with complaints of alopecia, malar rash, and photosensitivity. Her urinalysis shows proteins+ and red blood cells+. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the emergency room after a road traffic accident with a fracture in the right forearm. X-ray of the area reveals a distal radius fracture with dislocation of the distal radioulnar joint. What type of fracture is this?
Which of the following best describes the findings in osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Reduced surface area of the affected joints
Pain in the metacarpophalangeal and proximal interphalangeal joints
Asymmetric narrowing of joint spaces and osteophyte formation
Symmetrical narrowing of joint spaces and radiolucent periarticular region.

question: When is osteoarthritis referred as a primary disorder?

answers.option: Occurs as a consequence of some other disease

question: Which of the following processes is catalyzed by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT)?
Endochondral ossification is a process of bone formation that arises in hyaline cartilage. Which of the following bones is formed by endochondral ossification?

A 40-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of pain in the right metatarsophalangeal joint. He is diagnosed with a case of gout. Deficiency of which of the following enzymes is likely causing hyperuricemia in this patient?
A patient was prescribed hydralazine in order to control her hypertension. She later developed a malar rash, photosensitivity, and arthritis. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
Which of the following teratogens causes phocomelia in the developing fetus?

Celecoxib is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) having a decreased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding and ulcers as compared to most other NSAIDs. Which of the following is another effect which differentiates celecoxib from most other NSAIDs?
An X-ray technician has some concerns regarding X-ray exposure during his job. Which of the following is the most appropriate advice in this case?

answers.option: Keep the X-ray machine covered at all times
Wear an aluminum suit while working
Wear a lead apron while working

question: A 33-year-old female, who is a known case of depression and is being treated with sertraline, presents to the clinic with the complaint of generalized body aches. Her laboratory results show serum calcium 2.18 mmol/l, serum phosphate 0.79 mg/dl, alkaline phosphatase 178 IU/l, and parathyroid hormone 15 pg/ml. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A farmer presented to the emergency room with a complaint of a snake bite on his foot. On examination, a superficial bite mark was seen by a non-venomous snake. After disinfecting the wound, what would be the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Administer a high dose of heparin and steroids
Find the snake which caused the bite

question: What is the most common management for fractures of diaphysis of long bones?
Which of the following gases may be fatal if it is high in concentration in closed places like homes?
Which of the following is the most consistent feature of hip osteoarthritis?

A child presents to the clinic with the complaint of pain and swelling in the right knee, left ankle, and small joints of hands and feet. He had a history of fever one month back. He has increased platelets but a normal total leucocyte count. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents to an orthopedic clinic with a history of a fall on an outstretched hand 2 days ago. She sustained a fracture in her right radius at its distal end. Which of the following is the appropriate stage of healing fracture in this case?

A 3-year-old girl is brought to the clinic by her mother with persistent diarrhea. The mother reports that the local water supply is salty. What practical advice can be given to treat the temporary hardness in this water, and consequently improve the child's condition?
Why are NSAIDs preferred over colchicine for acute gout flares?

answers.option: They have uricosuric and analgesic effect
They have a more rapid action
They have a longer duration of action

question: A 6-year-old came with short stature below the 3rd percentile. His family has short stature from his father's side. He has frontal bossing, depressed nasal bridge, rhizomelia of lower limbs, and has frequent ear infections. He is also found to have kyphosis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following gases is known to seep out from under houses and leak during construction/digging of earth, and potentially cause lung cancer?
Which of the following drugs selectively inhibits the cyclooxygenase-2 enzyme?
Which of the following terms best defines a sequestrum?
Which of the following inhibits bone resorption?

A 35-year-old male presents to the clinic with bone pain and fever. A presumptive diagnosis of osteomyelitis is made. Culture reveals the presence of gram-negative diplococci. What is the most likely causative organism?
A 9-year-old child is brought to the clinic with pain in the right leg associated with swelling. X-ray reveals evidence of Brodie's abscess. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A newborn is noticed to have the right upper limb missing from the forearm onward. Which term best describes this condition?
Impairment in the function of which of the following cell types results in osteopetrosis?

An intravenous drug user presents with the complaint of burning micturition and fever for 3 days. He also has gritty eyes and lower back pain for the past 3 months. He also has an ulcer on the glans of the penis. What is the most likely cause of these symptoms?
A child presents to the emergency department with a radius fracture. The surgeon wants to preserve the periosteum. What is the most likely reason for preserving the periosteum?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with a complaint of dull hip pain for 3 years. On investigation, there is a mass of 10 cm × 13 cm attached to the hips which has irregular borders. Removal of the mass from ischium for biopsy reveals spotty calcifications. The transverse section of the mass reveals a blue-gray color. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A female G2 P1 presents to the clinic in the 21st week of gestation as she is not feeling fetal movements. On investigation, the fetus seems short-statured. The fetus is delivered at the 28th week of gestation as a stillborn baby and is noticed to have blue sclerae. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An athlete wishes to improve his physical performance. His sports physician recommends gradually increasing his exertion during his workout routine. What is this technique called?
Which section of the manuscript does not have references?
Which of the following sections contains the research objectives in a manuscript?
A researcher wants to add weightage to their own arguments in a research paper. Which of the following sections needs strong references to fulfill this purpose?
What is the most appropriate treatment for a fracture of the shaft of the femur?
How long after radiation exposure does leukemia develop?
An industrial worker operates machinery remotely to avoid being exposed to hazardous substances. What is the technical term used for this safety method?
What is the term used to describe the use of less toxic substances in place of more toxic substances?
Which of the following statements is true for the normal effects of aging on cognition?

answers.option: There is agitation and reduced alertness
Long term memory declines except for remote memories of emotional significance

question: A baby dies in utero due to multiple fractures. What is the most likely mutation causing this condition?
Which of the following conditions is the most appropriate consequence of hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT) deficiency?
What is the term used to describe the medical care of the elderly population?
Which of the following tissues gives rise to intramembranous bones?
Which compound is responsible for the viscosity of synovial fluid?
